title: EOF Implementers Call #23
body:
## Meeting Info
* [Sept 20, 2023, 15:00 UTC](https://savvytime.com/converter/utc-to-germany-berlin-united-kingdom-london-ny-new-york-city-ca-san-francisco-china-shanghai-japan-tokyo-australia-sydney/sep-20-2023/15-00)
* Duration: 60 minutes
* Zoom: TBA
ðŸ“… Subscribe to the [Ethereum Protocol Call calendar](https://calendar.google.com/calendar/u/1?cid=Y191cGFvZm9uZzhtZ3JtcmtlZ243aWM3aGs1c0Bncm91cC5jYWxlbmRhci5nb29nbGUuY29t) for calendar invites
* Current spec: https://notes.ethereum.org/@ipsilon/mega-eof-specification

### Agenda
* Client updates
* Compiler updates
* Spec updates
* Testing updates

To summarize still open questions:

1. Validate first-level subcontainers at deploy time so that `CREATE3` doesn't need to validate initcode at runtime - suggested by Vyper
2. `CREATE3` variant that has additional address parameter to get initcode from a container of another account - suggested by Vyper
3. [`CREATEF`](https://hackmd.io/@shemnon/CREATEF) - gets rid of one level of container nesting
4. `JUMPFI` - highly desirable by Vyper
  4a. or alternatively less restricted stack validation (one idea at https://github.com/ethereum/evmone/pull/676)
5. `SWAPMN` - highly desirable by Vyper
6. `RETURNDATALOAD` alongside revamped CALLs - suggested by Vyper
7. `EXTDATACOPY` - decided to be proposed in a separate EIP, EIP pending
8. Gas costs for some instructions not specified yet
9. Creator Contract and deprecation of creation transaction

### Minor nice-to-haves:

10.1. Forbid unreachable sections
10.2. Make data section optional again
10.3. Make `max_stack_height` in the header to mean upper bound
10.4. CREATE4 needs to define limits for initcontainers transaction field (In the spec: `is there size limit on the initcontainer in a transaction?`)
